form.name: form1

td.a: 2020 U.S. News & World Report Ranks WHS
High School is recipient of 2019 Momentum Award
2017 Division V State Football Champions Recognized

p.span: The Technology Department typically works in the background, supporting the teaching and learning of staff and students. During this COVID-19 school closure, however, we have been very busy and very visible. Our initial response focused on getting school chromebooks checked out to any student that needed one, in order to complete their digital assignments. Through a chromebook survey, we determined who needed to borrow one and then scheduled times for pickup.

br.span: After meeting that initial need, we looked outward to see how we could contribute to supporting efforts. We have been using our 3-D printers to print PPE masks. We reached out to the Robert C. Byrd Institute, affiliated with Marshall University in Huntington. They have an approved design for a reusable N95 mask, which they shared with us. N95 masks cover the wearer’s nose and mouth to protect against potentially harmful airborne particles by filtering at least 95 percent of particles as small as 0.3 microns in size.

The High School MIT class has been working remotely with Mr. Tom Vallance, Technology Coordinator, to produce a remote news video to share the impact COVID has had on school operations and the community as a whole. Be watching for this video to be posted on the website soon.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif; background: white

br.span: THANK YOU, Mr. Vallance for continuing to reach out to and work with students and to help the District be part of the solution. #THEBURGWAY

span.div:
Attention Juniors and Seniors:
With the school closure being extended through May, Prom is now scheduled for June 13th. Grand March will begin at 6:30 p.m. in the gym, followed by dinner at 7:30 p.m. in the cafetorium. If you are planning on bringing a guest from another school, please email Mr. Porter the Name, School and Grade of your guest.

div.strong: *This is subject to change based on Governor DeWine's guidance.

br.span:
Attention Seniors,
With the school closure being extended through May, graduation is now scheduled for Saturday, June 27th at 7:30 p.m. Graduation practice will be Friday, June 26th at 10:30 a.m. in the gym.
*This is subject to change based on Governor DeWine's guidance.
All graduation items, except caps and gowns, have been mailed to your homes. If you owe a balance, they were not mailed. You need to contact Kirk Thompson for questions about balances or new orders. His number is: 740-357-2160. His email is hjgradservices@gmail.com
Caps and gowns are being shipped to the high school and will be here on or before May 1st. I will send an email when they arrive with directions for picking them up here at the school. If you have not ordered a cap and gown yet, please contact Kirk at the number/email listed above.
IMPORTANT
Please email Mrs. Barrick the following 2 pieces of information by June 4th.
1. Name of your walking partner (these are not guaranteed).
2. Name of college or university where your final transcript needs to be sent.
Please share this information with your parents. Let me know if you have any questions.

div.span: The 39th Wheelersburg Alumni Banquet, scheduled for July 25, 2020 has been CANCELLED. The hosting Class of 1970, after much consideration, due to the uncertainty caused by COVID-19, has made this difficult decision

making plans with the Class of 1971 representatives to double the fun the following year, by combining resources and hosting a joint event, the Combined, 39th and 40th Alumni Banquet. Mark you calendars for July 31, 2021, for the 39/40 Wheelersburg Alumni Banquet Reunion. Details will be posted as they become available. Stay healthy, home and safe. See you in 2021. Go to the

span.div: Class contact should complete and return this letter to Karen Miller.

Ahoy! If your family is interested in attending the Wheelersburg Schools now is the time to act. Open Enrollment Applications for kindergarten through 12th grade students for the 2020-2021 school year are now being accepted. Follow the link below and return a completed application to P.O. Box 340, Wheelersburg, Ohio 45694; or email to OpenEnrollment@Wheelersburg.net
Click here for your open enrollment application!
Beginning Monday, March 30 student meals will be delivered on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. Follow the link below for locations and times.
Students and parents please review the information below regarding the District’s open enrollment program.
span.p: 1) The Open Enrollment forms for currently enrolled and returning students for the 2020-2021 school year should be returned by March 31.
2) The Open Enrollment informational meeting for new families wishing to enroll children in the Wheelersburg Schools scheduled for Thursday, March 26 has been cancelled.
3) New applications for the 2020-2021 school year will be accepted beginning on Monday, March 30. A link to the new application will be made available on Monday, March 30 on the District’s website.
5) Parents are encouraged to email their questions to OpenEnrollment@Wheelersburg.net .

div.a: State Board of Education Recognizes WHS

span.div: Wheelersburg High School has been recognized by the State Board of Education and the Ohio Department of Education as a recipient of the 2019 Momentum Award. The Momentum Award recognizes schools for exceeding expectations in student growth for the year. Schools must earn straight A’s on all Value-Added measures on the report card. The school or district must have at least two Value-Added subgroups of students, which includes gifted, lowest 20% in achievement, and students with disabilities.

Wheelersburg High School Principal Chris Porter stated, “There are a total of 48 districts and 173 schools recognized this year. This is another example of the hard work and attention to detail that our teachers, students and staff are putting in on a daily basis. It is also confirmation that our teachers and staff are focusing on the right improvement practices. Thank you to everyone for helping make this award a reality for our school. Congratulations!”
For additional information follow this link to the Ohio Department of Education’s website.

div.span: Important: Use OneView to update Student Information

span.div:
Reminder to Parents -- Use the online Oneview Program to update your address and phone number changes.
Also, please use the OneView system to update your child's health records. Have you taken your child to their physician lately? Were prescriptions changed for your child? If yes, update their records on OneView.

This way the school will always have the most current information concerning your child. This is important.
Lastly, please remember to update your free and reduced lunch application or apply for free and reduced lunches if your income has changed or the number in your household has changed.
For more information, call 740-574-2527 or 740-574-8130 and ask for the guidance department.
Bus Routes for the current school year are posted.

br.span: The calendar for the 2019-20 school year has been adopted. The calendar for state testing is being finalized and will be posted soon.
School supply lists have been posted for the 2019-20 school year. http://www.wheelersburg.net/supplylists7026.aspx
